snippet: Rick Santorum captured twin victories in Alabama and Mississippi on Tuesday, amplifying his argument that the nominating fight is becoming a two-man race, while Mitt Romney won Hawaii’s caucuses early on Wednesday.
abstract: Rick Santorum captures twin victories in the Alabama and Mississippi Republican presidential primaries, overcoming the financial advantages of Mitt Romney and the Southern allegiances to Newt Gingrich; Santorum's victories amplify his argument that the Republican nomination fight is becoming a two-man race with Romney.

byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson contributed reporting from Dixie, Miss.; Ashley Parker from Kirkwood, Mo., and Marjorie Connelly from New York.

lead_paragraph: Rick Santorum captured twin victories in Alabama and Mississippi on Tuesday, amplifying his argument that the nominating fight is becoming a two-man race, while Mitt Romney won Hawaii’s caucuses early on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Santorum Wins Alabama and Mississippi Primaries
headline.main: Santorum Takes 2 Races in South; Romney Is Third
headline.print_headline: Santorum Takes 2 Races In South; Romney Is Third
headline.sub: Wins Turn Contest Into Delegate Fight With Romney
